intro: Damnacanthus indicus var. okinawensis, commonly known as the Okinawan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near water sources. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
